You are a teacher and one of your students enjoys drawing during breaks. Choice 1: I allow the student to keep drawing during breaks as long as it doesnt interfere with their studies. Choice 2: I forbid the student from drawing during breaks.

You are a manager at a company, and your employee has a hobby of collecting stamps during their lunch breaks. Choice 1: I appreciate their unique hobby and let them continue doing it during their break time. Choice 2: I tell the employee to stop collecting stamps during lunch breaks as it is unprofessional.

You are planning a surprise party for your spouse, who loves salsa dancing. Choice 1: I arrange a salsa dance instructor to come and give a lesson at the party. Choice 2: I invite a ballroom dance instructor instead, even though my spouse doesnt enjoy that style.

You are a librarian, and a teenager comes to the library to borrow books from the romance section. Choice 1: I help them find the books they are looking for and let them borrow them. Choice 2: I discourage them from reading romance novels and suggest a different genre instead.

You are at a family gathering, and your cousin is enthusiastically sharing their new photography skills. Choice 1: I encourage my cousin and listen to their stories. Choice 2: I criticize their photography skills and tell them to talk about something else.

You are at a restaurant with a friend who loves trying out exotic foods. Choice 1: I support their choice and try some exotic dishes together. Choice 2: I discourage them from ordering exotic dishes and insist on ordering familiar food.

You are at a sports event, and your friend is cheering loudly for their favorite team. Choice 1: I join them in cheering or enjoy the atmosphere without interrupting their enthusiasm. Choice 2: I tell them to be quiet and stop cheering.

You are shopping with your friend who enjoys trying on different outfits. Choice 1: I encourage them to try on various outfits and express their personal style. Choice 2: I tell them they should only try on basic outfits and not waste time with their personal style.

You are at an art class, and a student enjoys making abstract paintings. Choice 1: I encourage them to continue exploring their creativity and unique style. Choice 2: I tell them to stop making abstract paintings and focus only on realistic ones.

You are at a poetry reading event, and your friend is excited to share their newest poem. Choice 1: I give them positive feedback and encouragement to share their work. Choice 2: I tell them their poem isnt good enough and they shouldnt share it.

You are at a party, and a group of people are enjoying playing a board game. Choice 1: I join in the game if Im interested or let them continue to enjoy it without interruption. Choice 2: I tell them board games are boring and insist on doing something else.

You are at a conference, and your colleague enjoys attending workshops and talks on various topics. Choice 1: I support their enthusiasm and attend some workshops together. Choice 2: I tell them they should skip workshops and just network with people.

You are at a friends house, and they are excited to show you their new gardening project. Choice 1: I express interest and ask questions about their project. Choice 2: I tell them gardening is a waste of time and dismiss their efforts.

You are at a cooking class, and a participant is excited about learning to bake a cake. Choice 1: I share their excitement and encourage their passion for baking. Choice 2: I tell them cake baking is too simple and they should learn something more complicated.

You are at a language exchange event, and your friend is excited about practicing their new language skills. Choice 1: I encourage them to practice and learn from native speakers. Choice 2: I tell them their language skills are not good enough and they should not practice in public.

You are at a comedy show, and your friend is laughing at the comedians jokes. Choice 1: I enjoy the show and let my friend have a good time. Choice 2: I tell my friend the jokes are not funny and ask them to stop laughing.

You are at a volunteer event, and a participant enjoys helping with the childrens activities. Choice 1: I appreciate their enthusiasm and support their efforts in helping the children. Choice 2: I tell them childrens activities are not important and they should do something else.

You are at a beach, and a family is enjoying a beach volleyball game. Choice 1: I let them enjoy their game without any interference. Choice 2: I walk up to them and insist they play a different game I prefer.

You are a roommate of a music lover who enjoys playing the guitar in their free time. Choice 1: I respect their hobby and allow them to play the guitar during the day. Choice 2: I ask them to stop playing the guitar or play only when I am not around.

You are a parent of a teenager who enjoys spending time with their friends on the weekends. Choice 1: I allow my child to attend sleepovers and hang out with their friends on weekends. Choice 2: I insist that they stay home every weekend and not go out with their friends.

You are a manager of a team that has just completed a successful project, and your team members are excited to celebrate by having a team lunch. Choice 1: I organize a team lunch for everyone to enjoy and unwind. Choice 2: I disallow the team lunch, stating that its not necessary and they should focus on the next project instead.

You are a spouse of someone who enjoys watching their favorite TV show after a long day at work. Choice 1: I join in or give them space to watch their favorite show without interruption. Choice 2: I complain about their TV show and insist that they watch something else or turn off the TV.

You are a gym owner, and one of your customers enjoys listening to loud music while working out. Choice 1: I provide designated areas where people can listen to loud music, ensuring everyones satisfaction. Choice 2: I ban loud music in the gym or confront the customer about their music volume, forcing them to use headphones.

You are a coworker of someone who enjoys taking mini breaks to play mobile games throughout the workday. Choice 1: I respect their way of managing stress, as long as it doesnt interfere with their work. Choice 2: I report them to the manager for not being focused on work all the time.

You are a neighbor of a family who loves to have barbecues in their backyard on weekends. Choice 1: I let them enjoy their barbecues, or even join them if invited. Choice 2: I complain about the smell and noise to them or the neighborhood association.

You are a friend of someone who enjoys attending live music concerts. Choice 1: I support their interests and maybe even attend some concerts together. Choice 2: I try to persuade them that live music concerts are a waste of time and money.

You are a parent of a child who loves to play video games in their spare time. Choice 1: I allow my child to play video games within reasonable limits. Choice 2: I forbid my child from playing video games, citing that they should focus on more productive activities.

You are a manager of an office where employees enjoy decorating their desks with personal items. Choice 1: I encourage employees to personalize their space, promoting creativity and comfort. Choice 2: I implement a strict policy to prevent employees from decorating their desks.

You are a city council member deciding on whether to approve a new park which includes a skatepark for local skateboarders. Choice 1: I support the creation of the park with the skatepark, accommodating the interests of the local skateboarders. Choice 2: I vote against the inclusion of the skatepark, arguing that it attracts a bad crowd.

You are a friend of a couple who loves to travel and share their experiences on social media. Choice 1: I enjoy their posts and comment positively on their adventures. Choice 2: I criticize them for traveling too much and being too self-absorbed.

You are a neighbor of an older couple who enjoys gardening and spends many hours tending to their plants. Choice 1: I appreciate their efforts in beautifying the neighborhood and compliment their garden. Choice 2: I complain about the time they spend gardening, saying its unnecessary and a waste of water.

You are a member of an online forum where people discuss their love for a specific TV series. Choice 1: I participate in the discussions, respecting everyones opinions and enjoyment. Choice 2: I post negative comments about the TV series, trying to convince others that its not worth watching.

You are a relative of someone who loves to collect vintage action figures and displays them in their home. Choice 1: I support their hobby and maybe even buy them a vintage action figure as a gift occasionally. Choice 2: I mock their interest in collectibles and suggest that they should grow out of it.

You are a coworker of someone who loves to experiment with different types of coffee to find their perfect blend. Choice 1: I encourage their experimentation and maybe even try some of their blends. Choice 2: I tell them their experimentation is a waste of time and resources.

You are a family member of someone who enjoys spending their weekends painting. Choice 1: I support their hobby and appreciate their artwork. Choice 2: I criticize their painting and suggest they find a more practical way to spend their time.

You are a member of a community group where people enjoy bird watching and photography. Choice 1: I participate in the bird-watching activities and support others interests. Choice 2: I complain about the groups focus on bird watching and push for different activities.

You are a coworker of someone who enjoys listening to podcasts during their lunch break. Choice 1: I allow them to enjoy their podcasts and maybe even ask for recommendations. Choice 2: I criticize their choice of content and suggest that they should socialize during lunch instead.

You are a teacher of a student who enjoys participating in after-school theater programs. Choice 1: I support the students passion for theater and encourage their participation. Choice 2: I discourage the student from participating, claiming it distracts them from their academic performance.

You are a gym owner, and one of your clients loves attending Zumba classes as part of their exercise routine. Choice 1: I offer a variety of Zumba classes and encourage the client to continue attending. Choice 2: I cancel all Zumba classes and replace them with other types of workouts that the client does not enjoy.

You are a restaurant owner, and one of your regular customers enjoys a specific dessert that you serve. Choice 1: I continue offering the dessert and ensure it remains part of the menu. Choice 2: I discontinue the dessert, even though it brings joy to the customer.

You are a supervisor, and one of your team members enjoys decorating their workspace with personal items to make it feel more comfortable. Choice 1: I allow the team member to personalize their workspace as long as it remains professional. Choice 2: I enforce a strict policy that bans personal items in workspaces.

You are a school principal, and you notice that a group of students enjoys playing chess during their lunch break. Choice 1: I support their interest in chess and consider starting a chess club. Choice 2: I ban the playing of chess during lunch break and confiscate the chess sets.

You are a librarian, and a patron is enjoying a humorous book that makes them laugh out loud. Choice 1: I continue my work and let the patron enjoy their book. Choice 2: I tell the patron they must stop laughing or leave the library.

You are working at an ice cream parlor, and a customer is taking their time sampling flavors. Choice 1: I let the customer taste the flavors and choose their favorite. Choice 2: I tell the customer that they have taken too long and must make a decision immediately.

You are a parent, and your child is playing in the park, swinging on the swings with joy. Choice 1: I sit nearby and watch my child play, enjoying their happiness. Choice 2: I tell my child they have been on the swings long enough and must move on to another activity.

You are an office manager, and during lunch break, a group of employees gathers in the break room to play a board game. Choice 1: I acknowledge their enjoyment and allow them to continue playing during their break. Choice 2: I tell the employees that the break room is not for games and ask them to stop playing.

You are a landlord, and your tenant loves gardening and has planted flowers in the front yard. Choice 1: I appreciate the beauty of the flowers and let my tenant continue gardening. Choice 2: I tell my tenant that gardening is not allowed and ask them to remove the flowers.

You are a bus driver, and a group of passengers is enjoying a conversation and laughing together during the ride. Choice 1: I appreciate their joy and continue driving without interruption. Choice 2: I announce over the intercom that they should quiet down and stop laughing.

You are a supervisor at a call center, and during breaks, an employee enjoys listening to music with headphones. Choice 1: I allow the employee to continue listening to music during their breaks. Choice 2: I tell the employee that listening to music is distracting and not allowed during breaks.

You are on a long train journey, and a fellow passenger is engrossed in a captivating novel. Choice 1: I allow the passenger to continue enjoying their book. Choice 2: I start a conversation with the passenger, interrupting their reading.

You are a flight attendant, and a passenger enjoys knitting during the flight. Choice 1: I allow the passenger to continue knitting and enjoy their flight. Choice 2: I tell the passenger that knitting is not allowed and request they put it away.

You are a camp counselor, and during free time, a group of campers is having fun playing cards. Choice 1: I let the campers continue playing cards and enjoying their free time. Choice 2: I tell the campers that playing cards is not an appropriate activity and ask them to stop.

You are an art gallery attendant, and a visitor is enamored with a particular painting, spending a long time appreciating it. Choice 1: I allow the visitor to continue enjoying the painting at their leisure. Choice 2: I tell the visitor that they have spent too much time on one painting and should move on.

You are a college professor, and during a study session, one of the students is making progress by creating detailed notes using colorful pens. Choice 1: I encourage the students creativity and let them continue taking notes in their preferred method. Choice 2: I tell the student that using colorful pens is distracting and ask them to use only black or blue ink.

You are a community pool lifeguard, and a group of teenagers is having fun playing a game of water volleyball. Choice 1: I supervise the game and let the teenagers continue enjoying their time at the pool. Choice 2: I tell the teenagers that playing water volleyball is disruptive and ask them to stop.

You are a museum tour guide, and a visitor enjoys taking photos of the exhibits to document their visit. Choice 1: I allow the visitor to continue taking photos as long as flash photography is not used. Choice 2: I tell the visitor that taking photos is not allowed and ask them to put their camera away.

You are a hostel owner, and a guest enjoys playing the piano in the common room. Choice 1: I let the guest continue playing the piano and sharing their music with others. Choice 2: I tell the guest that playing the piano is disturbing other guests and ask them to stop.

You are a student who just finished a group project and are discussing individual contributions with your group mates. Choice 1: I share my contributions and give credit to my teammates for their work. Choice 2: I exaggerate my contributions and downplay the efforts of my teammates.

You are a salesperson at a store, and a customer is asking about a products features. Choice 1: I explain the products features accurately and highlight both its strengths and limitations. Choice 2: I misrepresent the products features and hide its limitations to push the customer to buy it.

You are a job applicant discussing your previous work experience in an interview. Choice 1: I describe my work experience truthfully, highlighting my accomplishments and lessons learned. Choice 2: I falsely claim to have held higher positions or achieved more than I actually did to impress the interviewer.

You are a government official creating a report on the environmental impact of a proposed project. Choice 1: I present a fair and accurate analysis of the environmental consequences, including any potential harm or benefits. Choice 2: I manipulate data or omit negative impacts to ensure the projects approval.

You are a scientist conducting research on a new medication. Choice 1: I report my findings accurately, including any negative side effects or limitations. Choice 2: I suppress or alter negative results to secure funding or gain approval for the medication.

You are a roommate who accidentally broke a shared household item. Choice 1: I confess to breaking the item and offer to replace or repair it. Choice 2: I hide the broken item and pretend I dont know what happened to it.

You are a journalist reporting on a controversial topic. Choice 1: I present a balanced and objective account, including diverse perspectives and accurate information. Choice 2: I distort facts or selectively present information to support a specific viewpoint or agenda.

You are a driver involved in a minor car accident and are discussing the situation with the other driver. Choice 1: I honestly explain the circumstances of the accident and take responsibility if I am at fault. Choice 2: I blame the other driver, even if I know I am at fault, to avoid liability.

You are a tour guide presenting historical information about a famous site. Choice 1: I share accurate and well-researched facts about the site and its history. Choice 2: I make up sensational stories or exaggerate historical events to entertain the tourists.

You are a restaurant server, and a customer asks for your opinion on a dish. Choice 1: I give my honest opinion, including any positive or negative aspects. Choice 2: I praise the dish, even if I dont like it, to encourage the customer to order it.

You are an athlete competing in a race and realize you took a shortcut unintentionally. Choice 1: I report the shortcut to race officials and accept any penalties. Choice 2: I keep silent about the shortcut and claim victory if I happen to win.

You are a store owner offering a refund policy for your products. Choice 1: I honor the refund policy honestly and fairly, even if it means losing some profit. Choice 2: I find loopholes or make excuses to avoid issuing refunds to customers.

You are a coworker who overhears colleagues gossiping about another coworker. Choice 1: I avoid participating in the gossip and encourage others to focus on positive or work-related topics. Choice 2: I spread false or exaggerated information about the coworker to fit in with the gossiping group.

You are a dietician providing weight loss advice to a client. Choice 1: I offer evidence-based and realistic guidance tailored to the clients needs and goals. Choice 2: I promote a fad diet or extreme weight loss methods, despite their potential harm or ineffectiveness.

You are a friend who borrowed money from another friend and promised to repay it by a specific date. Choice 1: I repay the money by the agreed-upon date or communicate any issues that prevent timely repayment. Choice 2: I make up a false excuse for not repaying the money and hope my friend doesnt confront me.

You are a social media influencer reviewing a product for your followers. Choice 1: I provide an honest assessment of the product, including its pros and cons. Choice 2: I exaggerate the products benefits and conceal its flaws to maintain a positive relationship with the brand.

You are a real estate agent representing a property with some flaws. Choice 1: I disclose the propertys flaws to potential buyers, as well as its selling points. Choice 2: I hide the flaws and emphasize only the positive aspects to increase the chances of a sale.

You are a job applicant who exaggerated your skills on your resume. Choice 1: I update my resume with accurate information before the interview and inform the interviewer about the changes. Choice 2: I continue with the interview, pretending the exaggerated skills are accurate.

You are a politician who made a promise during the election campaign that you now realize is unachievable. Choice 1: I admit to the public that I was overly ambitious and propose a more feasible alternative. Choice 2: I blame external factors or opponents for preventing the fulfillment of the promise.

You are a coach who has to decide which player will take an important penalty kick. Choice 1: I choose the player based on their performance and skill, even if it disappoints another player. Choice 2: I lie to the less skilled player about an injury to avoid hurting their feelings.

You are an artist who accidentally used copyrighted material in your creation. Choice 1: I remove the copyrighted material and apologize to the original creator. Choice 2: I deny using the material and accuse the original creator of copying me.

You are a store clerk and a customer asks for a product that is out of stock. Choice 1: I apologize for the inconvenience and suggest alternative products or stores. Choice 2: I tell the customer that the product was discontinued to avoid admitting the store is out of stock.

You are a journalist who discovers a scandal involving a close friend. Choice 1: I report the story accurately and maintain my journalistic integrity. Choice 2: I suppress the story to protect my friends reputation.

You are a software engineer who accidentally introduced a bug in the code. Choice 1: I admit my mistake and work with my team to fix the bug. Choice 2: I blame a coworker for the bug and pretend I was not responsible.

You are a musician who discovers another bands song sounds similar to your own. Choice 1: I reach out to the band to discuss the similarities and find a solution. Choice 2: I publicly accuse the band of plagiarism without evidence, tarnishing their reputation.

You are a fitness instructor and a client asks if they can achieve unrealistic results. Choice 1: I set realistic expectations and encourage the client to pursue attainable goals. Choice 2: I promise the client that they can achieve their unrealistic goals to secure their patronage.

You are an actor auditioning for a role, but you have a scheduling conflict with the shooting dates. Choice 1: I inform the casting director of the conflict and try to work out a solution. Choice 2: I conceal the scheduling conflict, hoping I can deal with it after getting the role.

You are a wedding planner who accidentally double-booked a vendor for two events on the same day. Choice 1: I apologize to both clients and find an alternative solution or vendor. Choice 2: I lie to one client, claiming the vendor had an emergency, and cover up my mistake.

You are a student and you forgot to complete your assignment on time. Choice 1: I tell my teacher the truth that I forgot to complete the assignment. Choice 2: I lie to my teacher, saying that I submitted the assignment, but it must have gotten lost.

You are a doctor and a patients illness is much worse than they think. Choice 1: I am honest with the patient about their condition and discuss treatment options. Choice 2: I downplay the severity of the illness and tell them its just a minor issue.

You are a parent and your child asks where their pet dog, who recently passed away, has gone. Choice 1: I gently explain that their pet has passed away, and discuss ways to remember and honor their pet. Choice 2: I tell them the pet has gone on a long vacation and will return someday.

You are a tenant in an apartment building, and you find out that your landlord is illegally withholding your security deposit. Choice 1: I file a complaint with the appropriate housing authority and provide documentation of my claim. Choice 2: I stop paying rent until my landlord returns my security deposit.

You are a parent and you believe that your childs school is not providing adequate resources for students with disabilities. Choice 1: I meet with school administrators and advocate for changes, or file a formal complaint if necessary. Choice 2: I take matters into my own hands and make unauthorized modifications to the school building to accommodate my childs needs.

You are a journalist and you receive a trove of classified documents that reveal government corruption. Choice 1: I evaluate the legitimacy of the documents and consult with my editor about the best way to report on the information. Choice 2: I publish the documents without verifying their authenticity or considering the potential legal ramifications.

You are a homeowner who discovers that your neighbor has been stealing your internet by hacking into your Wi-Fi. Choice 1: I secure my Wi-Fi network and inform my neighbor that I am aware of their actions. Choice 2: I hack into my neighbors devices and steal their personal information as payback.

You are a manager and you find out that an employee is using company resources to mine cryptocurrency. Choice 1: I confront the employee, document their actions, and follow company procedures for handling misconduct. Choice 2: I blackmail the employee, demanding a share of their profits in exchange for my silence.

You are a bank teller and you discover a loophole in the banks system that would allow you to manipulate transactions. Choice 1: I report the loophole to my supervisor and work on a solution to fix it. Choice 2: I exploit the loophole to divert funds to my personal account.

You are a student who has uncovered evidence of cheating within your schools sports team. Choice 1: I report the cheating to school administrators and provide the evidence Ive found. Choice 2: I blackmail the team members involved in the cheating, demanding favors or money in exchange for my silence.

You are a scientist working on a new medication and you realize that it may have dangerous side effects. Choice 1: I report my findings to the appropriate regulatory agencies and halt further development until the issue is resolved. Choice 2: I continue testing the medication on human subjects without disclosing the potential risks.

You are a wildlife photographer and you come across a rare, endangered animal in the wild. Choice 1: I take photographs from a safe distance, without disturbing the animal or its habitat. Choice 2: I attempt to capture the animal to sell it to a collector for a high price.

You are a driver and you notice that your vehicles registration has expired. Choice 1: I renew my vehicle registration as soon as possible and avoid driving until its updated. Choice 2: I continue driving with the expired registration and hope that I dont get pulled over.

You are a museum curator and you discover that an exhibit contains a stolen artifact. Choice 1: I report the stolen artifact to the authorities and remove it from the exhibit. Choice 2: I keep the artifact on display and hope that nobody notices its stolen.

You are a doctor in a hospital and a patient who has been showing severe symptoms arrives with no appointment. Choice 1: I prioritize the patients health by providing immediate medical attention. Choice 2: I ignore the patient because they do not have an appointment.

You are a parent and your child has broken an expensive vase at a friends house. Choice 1: I take responsibility and offer to pay for the damaged vase. Choice 2: I blame the friends child and refuse to pay for the vase.

You are an accountant and discover fraudulent activities in your companys financial records. Choice 1: I report the issue to my supervisor or the appropriate authorities. Choice 2: I cover up the fraud to protect my companys reputation.

You are a firefighter on the scene of an emergency and there is a trapped person inside a burning building. Choice 1: I follow proper procedures to safely rescue the person. Choice 2: I ignore the person and focus on putting out the fire instead.

You are a veterinarian and a client brings in a severely injured stray animal. Choice 1: I provide necessary medical care for the animal, regardless of the owners ability to pay. Choice 2: I refuse to treat the animal unless the client pays for the services upfront.

You are a scientist conducting research that has yielded groundbreaking results. Choice 1: I publish my findings in a reputable journal and share my knowledge with the scientific community. Choice 2: I keep the results to myself and attempt to profit from them.

You are a social worker and learn that a child in your care is being abused by their foster parent. Choice 1: I report the abuse and take appropriate steps to protect the child. Choice 2: I ignore the signs of abuse and do not intervene.

You are an environmental inspector and find a company illegally dumping hazardous waste. Choice 1: I report the violation and ensure the company is held responsible for their actions. Choice 2: I accept a bribe from the company and do not report the violation.

You are an electrician and find that a buildings wiring is not up to code. Choice 1: I inform the building owner and make necessary repairs to ensure safety. Choice 2: I ignore the issue and leave the wiring as it is, risking potential hazards.

You are a pharmacist and a customer brings in a prescription with an incorrect dosage. Choice 1: I contact the prescribing doctor to verify and correct the dosage. Choice 2: I fill the prescription as written, without verifying the potentially harmful dosage.

You are a doctor on duty at a hospital when you receive a call from a friend inviting you to a party. Choice 1: I decline the invitation and continue attending to my patients. Choice 2: I leave my patients unattended and go to the party.

You are a teacher responsible for supervising students during an important examination. Choice 1: I pay close attention to the students and ensure they follow exam rules. Choice 2: I ignore the students and spend my time browsing the internet on my phone.

You are a judge presiding over a trial where the defendant is a close family friend. Choice 1: I recuse myself from the case due to a potential conflict of interest. Choice 2: I preside over the case and try to influence the outcome in favor of my friend.

You are a parent, and your child is struggling to complete a challenging school project. Choice 1: I support and guide my child in completing the project without doing the work for them. Choice 2: I complete the project for my child and let them take credit for my work.

You are a police officer who notices a fellow officer behaving unethically. Choice 1: I report the misconduct to a superior or appropriate oversight body. Choice 2: I ignore the misconduct to avoid causing trouble for my colleague.

You are a firefighter responding to an emergency call, and the situation is dangerous. Choice 1: I follow safety protocols and work with my team to address the situation. Choice 2: I ignore safety protocols in an attempt to resolve the situation more quickly.

You are a manager who has received a complaint about an employees behavior. Choice 1: I investigate the complaint and address the issue according to company policy. Choice 2: I dismiss the complaint without investigation to maintain a pleasant work environment.

You are a pilot encountering technical difficulties during a flight. Choice 1: I follow established emergency procedures and communicate with air traffic control. Choice 2: I attempt to fix the issue on my own without informing anyone.

You are a lawyer representing a client who has confessed their guilt to you. Choice 1: I advise my client of their options and represent them within the bounds of professional ethics. Choice 2: I fabricate evidence to help my client avoid punishment.

You are a paramedic arriving at an accident scene with multiple injured individuals. Choice 1: I prioritize care based on the severity of each persons injuries. Choice 2: I treat the most affluent-looking individual first, hoping for a generous thank-you.

You are a counselor and one of your clients shares highly sensitive information with you. Choice 1: I maintain confidentiality and provide support according to professional guidelines. Choice 2: I share the information with friends or family out of curiosity or for entertainment.

You are a lifeguard on duty when you spot a swimmer in distress. Choice 1: I respond to the emergency and follow rescue protocols. Choice 2: I wait for another lifeguard to notice and handle the situation.

You are an engineer designing a bridge that must meet strict safety standards. Choice 1: I ensure my design meets or exceeds all required safety specifications. Choice 2: I cut corners on the design to save money and speed up construction.

You are a chef who has received a food delivery containing spoiled ingredients. Choice 1: I refuse the delivery and order replacement ingredients to maintain food quality. Choice 2: I use the spoiled ingredients and hope customers dont notice.

You are an electrician working on a project when you find a potential safety hazard. Choice 1: I address the hazard and ensure the electrical system meets safety requirements. Choice 2: I ignore the hazard to finish the job more quickly.

You are a nurse who made a mistake during a patients treatment that could have severe consequences. Choice 1: I report the mistake to the appropriate supervisor and work to correct the error. Choice 2: I cover up the mistake and hope no one notices.

You are an animal shelter worker, and a new volunteer mistreats an animal. Choice 1: I report the incident to my supervisor and ensure appropriate training for the volunteer. Choice 2: I ignore the mistreatment to avoid confrontation or drama.
You are a construction worker and notice a safety issue on the job site. Choice 1: I alert my supervisor and ensure the issue is addressed. Choice 2: I keep quiet to avoid delays or extra work.

You are a parent of three children, and your youngest child is struggling with schoolwork. Choice 1: I help my child with their schoolwork and provide additional support. Choice 2: I ignore their struggles and let them figure it out on their own.

You are an environmental engineer designing a new wastewater treatment system. Choice 1: I ensure the system meets environmental and safety regulations. Choice 2: I cut corners and use cheaper materials, ignoring regulations.

You are a software engineer developing a new app with sensitive user data. Choice 1: I implement proper security measures to protect users data. Choice 2: I ignore security best practices and allow for potential data breaches.

You are a police officer called to a domestic dispute. Choice 1: I deescalate the situation and follow department protocols. Choice 2: I use excessive force without attempting to deescalate the situation.
You are a scientist conducting research in a laboratory. Choice 1: I follow proper protocols and ensure the integrity of my research. Choice 2: I falsify data to make my results seem more impressive.

You are a pilot preparing for takeoff. Choice 1: I complete all pre-flight checks and ensure the safety of the passengers. Choice 2: I skip pre-flight checks and leave on time, despite potential safety risks.

You are a construction manager overseeing a new building project. Choice 1: I ensure all safety regulations are met and workers are properly trained. Choice 2: I ignore safety regulations to cut costs and speed up the project.
You are a counselor assisting a client in crisis. Choice 1: I listen carefully, provide support, and follow ethical guidelines. Choice 2: I brush off the clients concerns and give unsolicited advice.

You are an accountant handling the finances of a small business. Choice 1: I accurately report the financial information and ensure compliance with tax laws. Choice 2: I falsify financial records to save the business money on taxes.

You are a lifeguard on duty at a crowded beach. Choice 1: I stay vigilant, watch for signs of distress, and prepare to respond. Choice 2: I leave my post to join my friends in the water, ignoring my responsibility.

You are an architect designing a new building. Choice 1: I ensure the building meets all safety and accessibility regulations. Choice 2: I ignore regulations to create a visually striking building that may be unsafe or inaccessible.

You are a veterinarian treating a sick animal. Choice 1: I provide appropriate care and communicate with the owner about their pets condition. Choice 2: I perform unnecessary tests and treatments to increase revenue.
You are a social worker helping a family in need. Choice 1: I devote time and resources to provide assistance and support. Choice 2: I neglect the familys needs and prioritize easier cases.

You are a lawyer representing a client in a criminal case. Choice 1: I uphold my ethical obligations and provide the best possible defense. Choice 2: I ignore evidence that could help my client in favor of a quicker resolution.

You are a police officer, and you witness a crime taking place. Choice 1: I intervene and follow the proper procedures to apprehend the suspect. Choice 2: I turn a blind eye and let the criminal get away.

You are a bus driver, and a passenger is having a medical emergency on your bus. Choice 1: I pull over the bus and contact emergency services to provide medical assistance. Choice 2: I continue driving and ignore the passengers medical emergency.

You are a pilot, and your plane encounters unexpected turbulence during a flight. Choice 1: I follow established protocols and take necessary precautions to ensure passenger safety. Choice 2: I ignore the turbulence and continue the flight without taking any safety precautions.

You are a scientist, and you discover errors in a published research paper you co-authored. Choice 1: I notify my co-authors and work together to correct the errors and submit a revision. Choice 2: I ignore the errors and hope that no one else notices them.

You are a lawyer, and your client asks you to engage in unethical practices to win their case. Choice 1: I refuse the request and continue to represent my client within the bounds of the law. Choice 2: I comply with the clients request and engage in unethical practices.

You are a bank manager, and an employee reports suspicious activity on a customers account. Choice 1: I investigate the suspicious activity and follow proper procedures to protect the customer. Choice 2: I ignore the report and assume it is a false alarm without looking into it.

You are a doctor working in a hospital. Your shift ends, but there is a patient who needs immediate attention. Choice 1: I stay and attend to the patient, making sure they receive the proper care. Choice 2: I leave the hospital, ignoring the patients needs and prioritizing my personal schedule instead.

You are a firefighter and your station receives a call about a fire in a nearby building. Choice 1: I gear up, coordinate with my team, and head to the scene to extinguish the fire. Choice 2: I ignore the call and continue playing cards with my colleagues, claiming that someone else will handle it.

You are a police officer patrolling the streets when you see a group of people vandalizing property. Choice 1: I intervene and address the situation according to my departments protocol. Choice 2: I drive away and pretend I didnt see the vandalism, avoiding confrontation.

You are a bus driver and your shift is ending, but there is still one passenger on board who needs a ride to their destination. Choice 1: I continue driving until the passenger reaches their destination safely. Choice 2: I end my shift and ask the passenger to get off the bus, making them find another way to their destination.

You are a journalist covering an important news story that impacts public safety. Choice 1: I report the facts accurately and promptly to ensure the public is well-informed. Choice 2: I publish a sensationalized story with misleading information to generate more clicks and revenue.

You are a professional athlete, and you have the opportunity to use performance-enhancing drugs without getting caught. Choice 1: I choose not to use the drugs and maintain my integrity and the spirit of fair competition. Choice 2: I use the drugs to improve my performance, disregarding the ethical implications and potential consequences.

You are a scientist conducting research and find evidence that contradicts a popular and lucrative theory supported by your colleagues. Choice 1: I present my findings honestly and openly, despite the potential backlash from my peers. Choice 2: I alter my data or suppress my findings to align with the popular theory and maintain my professional standing.

You are a financial advisor and notice an elderly clients family is taking advantage of their wealth. Choice 1: I inform the client of the situation and help them create a plan to protect their assets. Choice 2: I ignore the issue and continue managing the clients investments, preserving my own profit from their account.

You are a judge presiding over a trial involving an individual with substantial political connections. Choice 1: I ensure a fair trial, treating the defendant the same as any other, regardless of their connections. Choice 2: I favor the defendant to gain political favors and advance my own career.

You are an electrician repairing a faulty wiring issue in a clients home. Choice 1: I complete the repair thoroughly and ensure the safety of the electrical system. Choice 2: I perform a temporary fix to save time and money, knowing the issue may reoccur and put the homeowner at risk.

You are a city planner tasked with approving new construction projects, and a developer offers you a bribe to expedite their permits. Choice 1: I decline the bribe and follow the proper procedures and regulations for approving permits. Choice 2: I accept the bribe and prioritize the developers permits, disregarding the proper process and ethical standards.

You are a chef preparing a meal for a customer with a severe allergy. Choice 1: I follow proper food safety protocols to avoid cross-contamination and ensure the meal is safe for the customer. Choice 2: I ignore the allergy warning and prepare the meal as usual, risking the customers health.
